channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sell it, donate it — recycle it? A beloved old minivan faces a fork in the road
item.description: After 20 years of service, an NPR reporter's beloved minivan is on the fritz. But what is its best and highest calling now: Pass it on to another fami...

item.title: Florida Moves to End Vaccine Mandates, and Trump Battles Wind Farms
item.description: Plus, a Chinese coffee giant comes to America.

item.title: Are creatine supplements all that they're pumped up to be?
item.description: Creatine supplements have long become increasingly popular as social media influencers tout its benefits. What does the evidence say?

item.title: How the Education Department is using civil rights laws to bring schools to heel

item.title: What Can Democrats Do to Get Rid of the Scarlet L for Loser?
item.description: Is there a way for them to get rid of the scarlet L, for loser?

item.title: Russia Wants ‘Security Guarantees’ Too. Here’s What They Look Like.
item.description: The Kremlin’s vision of national security comes at the expense of Ukrainian sovereignty, underlining the challenges of striking a peace deal.

item.title: Europe Aims to Show It Is Ready to Secure Postwar Ukraine
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron of France is hosting a meeting of leaders who will review options for protecting any peace with Russia.

item.title: Vetements Takes Its Trademark Fight to U.S. Supreme Court
item.description: Why does Veuve Clicquot get a U.S. trademark while Vetements — home of the packing-tape minidress, no less! — does not? Its lawyers want to know.
